p: The extraction yield of the aerial parts and root samples of Z. spinosa is presented in Figure 1. The mean percentages of the yielded extracts are significantly ( p < 0.01) different among the plant parts and extractants used and vary from 9.5 ± 0.10% to 19.4 ± 0.44%, with a descending order of aerial parts, aqueous ethanol extract (Ap-AEE) > aerial parts, aqueous methanol extract (Ap-AME) > roots, aqueous ethanol extract (R-AEE) > roots, and aqueous methanol extract (R-AME). The highest percentage of yield was found in Ap-AEE (19.4 ± 0.44% w/w) while the lowest percentage of yield was found in R-AME (9.5 ± 0.10% w/w).
